IGF::OT::IGF SPACE-BASED GLOBAL MEASUREMENTS OF ATMOSPHERIC CO2 MUST BE COMPLEMENTED WITH OCEAN WATER ANALYSIS. MONITORING OCEAN ACIDIFICATION, WHICH RESULTS FROM THE ACCUMULATION OF CO2, IS OF CRITICAL INTEREST, SINCE PROGRESSIVE ACIDIFICATION IS ALREADY AFFECTING OCEANS AND COASTAL ESTUARIES AND WATERWAYS. TO THAT END, NASA AND NOAA ARE SEEKING IN-SITU MONITORING DEVICES FOR OCEANIC AND COASTAL WATER MONITORING, INCLUDING A PH SENSOR FOR SEAWATER, TO SUPPORT SPACE-BASED MONITORING PROGRAMS. MONITORING OCEAN PH ACCURATELY OVER LARGE AREAS HAS PROVED TO BE EXTREMELY DIFFICULT, AND CLASSIC SENSOR TECHNOLOGY, BASED ON POTENTIOMETRIC MEASUREMENTS (PH ELECTRODES), HAVE SHOWN SIGNIFICANT LIMITATIONS: CURRENT INSTRUMENTS ARE EXPENSIVE, DO NOT MONITOR PH DIRECTLY, AND THEREFORE NEED COMPLEX SIGNAL COMPENSATION TO YIELD ACCURATE MEASUREMENTS, AND REQUIRE FREQUENT CALIBRATION. INTELLIGENT OPTICAL SYSTEMS PROPOSES TO DEVELOP A NOVEL LUMINESCENT SENSOR FOR PH, TAKING ADVANTAGE OF NOVEL MATERIALS DEVELOPED TO MONITOR PH AND OTHER PARAMETERS OF INTEREST IN HIGH SALINITY AND ELEVATED PRESSURE ENVIRONMENTS; IT WILL EXHIBIT HIGH SELECTIVITY (DIRECT PH MEASUREMENTS) AND STABILITY. A NOVEL ANTIFOULING TECHNOLOGY WITH NO MECHANICAL PARTS WILL PREVENT SENSOR DEGRADATION IN SEAWATER. TO CONTAIN THE COST OF THE ELECTRONICS WHILE MAINTAINING HIGH PERFORMANCE IN DETECTING THE LUMINESCENT SIGNAL, WE WILL USE CIRCUIT SEED CIRCUITS, WHICH PROCESS ANALOG SIGNALS ON 100% DIGITAL COMPONENTS. THIS ENABLES THEM TO REDUCE SIZE AND PARTS COUNT, SIMPLIFYING QUALITY CONTROL AND POWER REQUIREMENTS, AND WILL ENABLE US TO PRODUCE HIGH-PERFORMANCE, LOW-COST OPTOELECTRONIC UNITS.

THIS DELL FIELD NOTEBOOK IS CRITICAL TO THE OCEAN DISPOSAL PROGRAM WHEN CONDUCTING OCEAN SURVEYS FOR OUR EPA DESIGNATED OCEAN DREDGED MATERIAL DISPOSAL SITES (ODMDS) AND TO INTERFACE WITH OTHER ELECTRONICS USED ON BOARD THE RESEARCH VESSEL. THE NOTEBOOK OFFERS STRONG PERFORMANCE AND RELIABLE DATA PROTECTION IN A DESIGN THAT IS BUILT TO WITHSTAND INSULTS FROM THE OCEAN MONITORING ENVIRONMENT, WATER FROM ROGUE WAVES, RAIN, HUMIDITY , EXTREME TEMPERATURES, ACCIDENTAL DROPS, SPILLS ETC . THE ANTIGLARE LED DISPLAY WITH DIRECTVUE TECHNOLOGY ALLOWS FOR SUNLIGHT READABILITY. THE NOTEBOOK IS CAPABLE OF RUNNING THE HYPACK LITE SOFTWARE AND NOBELTEC SOFTWARE PREVIOUSLY PURCHASED. HYPACK LITE IS USED TO RECORD BATHYMETRY DATA COLLECTED FROM ONBOARD FATHOMETERS AND ALSO INTERFACES WITH NOBELTEC SOFTWARE ALLOWING THE SCIENTIST TO MARK SAMPLING LOCATIONS REAL-TIME IN THE FIELD ALONG WITH OTHER PERTINENT DATA AND INFORMATION WHICH IS THEN STORED IN AN ELECTRONIC LOG.THE DELL FIELD NOTEBOOK IN ADDITION TO A US B PORT  WILL NEED TO BE EQUIPPED WITH A SERIAL PORT AND PCMCIA SLOT BECAUSE A LOT OF OLDER FIELD EQUIPMENT DOES NOT ADAPT WELL TO USB PORTS OR ADAPTERS, THE PCMICIA SLOT ALLOWS FOR THE ADDITION OF ADDITIONAL SERIAL PORTS IF NEEDED TO CONNECT TO MULTIIPLE COMPUTERS. A DVD WRITER IS NEEDED FOR BACKING UP DATA ON DVDS. A CARRYING CASE IS NEEDED TO TRANSPORT THE FIELD NOTEBOOK SAFELY.  EPA R6 HAS 14 ACTIVE ODMDS AND 5 NEW SITES ARE BEING ADDED. FEDERAL REGULATIONS REQUIRE THAT EPA MONITORS ITS SITES.  WE HAVE A LONG RANGE PLAN TO VISIT ALL OF THE SITES OVER THE NEXT FEW YEARS TO COLLECT BATHYMETRY, SIDE SCAN SONAR DATA, SEDIMENT SAMPLES, AND SEDIMENT PROFILE SAMPLES. THE DELL FIELD NOTEBOOK ALONG WITH THE HYPACK LITE SOFTWARE AND NOBELTEC SOFTWARE WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL IN THE ACQUISITION OF DATA FOR THESE SAMPLING TECHNIQUES. WE ARE RECOMMENDING THE PURCHASE OF THE DELL LATITUDE E6420 XFR FIELD NOTEBOOK BECAUSE IT MEETS OUR FIELD COMPUTING NEEDS FOR FY 13 AND INTO THE FUTURE.

IGF::OT::IGF "OTHER FUNCTIONS" - THE CLIMATE PROGRAM OFFICE (CPO) IS A FEDERAL OFFICE IN NOAA'S OFFICE OF OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC RESEARCH (OAR).  CPO AND ITS RESEARCH PARTNERS CONDUCT A WIDE RANGE OF RESEARCH INTO COMPLEX CLIMATE SYSTEMS AND HOW THEY WORK TO IMPROVE THEIR ABILITY TO PREDICT CLIMATE CHANGE AND VARIATION IN BOTH THE SHORTER TERM, LIKE COLD SPELLS OR PERIOD OF DROUGHT, AND OVER LONGER TERMS LIKE DECADES AND BEYOND.  THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE CPO WITH A RANGE OF DISCREET AND RECURRING CLIMATE SCIENCE-RELATED COMMUNICATIONS, EDUCATION, AND ENGAGEMENT TASKS AND DELIVERABLES THAT ARE NEEDED TO SUPPORT NOAA'S CLIMATE LITERACY IMPLEMENTATION PLAN (CLIP) FOR A PERIOD FTWELVE (12) MONTHS FROM THE AWARD OF THE ORDER.  IN ORDER TO COMMUNICATE WITH, EDUCATE AND ENGAGE DIVERSE TARGET PUBLICS ABOUT NOAA'S AND ITS PARTNER'S CLIMATE SCIENCES AND SERVICES, THE CPO REQUIRES ONGOING DESIGN, DEVELOPMENT, AND PRODUCTION OF ACCESSIBLE AND EASY-TO-UNDERSTAND INFORMATION RESOURCES -- INCLUDING SCIENCE WRITING AND EDITING, SCIENTIFIC DATA VISUALIZATIONS, ILLUSTRATIONS, GRAPHICS AND INTERFACE DESIGN, PROGRAMMING, PHOTOGRAPHY, AND VIDEOGRAPHY.  THESE RESOURCES SHALL BE PUBLISHED IN A RANGE OF THE AGENCY'S IN-REACH AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS -- INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO NOAA'S CLIMATE.GOV PORTAL, THE CPO'S WEBSITES, SCIENCE ON A SPHERE, DIGITAL PLANETARIUMS, DIGITAL VIDEO DISKS (DVD-ROM), STREAMING VIDEO OVER THE INTERNET, LIVE-AUDIENCE PRESENTATIONS, AND POSTERS AND PRINTED MATERIALS FOR DISPLAY AND HANDOUT.

IGF::OT::IGF OTHER FUNCTION - GROWING CONCERN OVER GLOBAL CLIMATIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES AND OUR URGENT NEED TO QUANTIFY TRACK AND UNDERSTAND THEIR IMPACT ON OUR PLANET?S ATMOSPHERE, OCEANS, AND LAND SURFACES HAVE PROMPTED THE DEVELOPMENT OF EXTREMELY SENSITIVE AND TECHNOLOGICALLY SOPHISTICATED INSTRUMENTS. TO MEET THE CHALLENGES OF THESE NEXT GENERATION INSTRUMENTS, A NEW CLASS OF HIGH PERFORMANCE ELECTRONICS NEEDS TO BE DEVELOPED. IN THIS SBIR PHASE II PROPOSAL, MOSAIX PROPOSES TO DESIGN AND BUILD TWO SEPARATE LOW POWER, AND COMPACT SINGLE BOARD DIGITAL POLY-PHASE FAST FOURIER TRANSFORM SPECTROMETER (FFTS) OPTIMIZED FOR THE BACK-END SIGNAL PROCESSING REQUIREMENTS OF NEXT GENERATION INSTRUMENTS. THESE TWO SPECTROMETER DESIGNS ARE TARGETED TO MEET DIFFERENT MISSION REQUIREMENTS AND LEVERAGE A COMMON FPGA BASED DIGITAL ELECTRONIC DESIGN AND SPECTROMETER IP CORE. WHILST SHARING A COMMON ARCHITECTURE, THE BOARDS DIFFER IN THE ANALOG-TO-DIGITAL (ADC) SAMPLERS USED AT THE FRONT-END OF THE SPECTROMETER AND THE ACTUAL FPGA DEVICE USED FOR THE DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSING TASKS. THE FIRST SPECTROMETER DESIGN IS FOR A 8 GHZ BANDWIDTH SPECTROMETER TARGETED FOR EARTH OBSERVING (EOS) MISSIONS. THE SECOND SPECTROMETER DESIGN IS FOR A 750 MHZ BANDWIDTH SPECTROMETER TARGETED FOR PLANETARY RADIOMETER MISSIONS. THE SPECTROMETERS DEVELOPED UNDER THIS SBIR WILL BE STATE-OF-THE-ART SPECTROMETERS.

PROJECT CONSISTS OF INTERPRETATION AND MAPPING OF PREVIOUS COLLECTED AERIAL VIDEO AND DIGITAL STILL IMAGERY OF THE COASTAL ZONE.

SBIR PHASE III CONTRACT.  IN PHASE- III, RSS SHALL INTEGRATE THE SBIR PHASE- II DEVELOPED COMPONENTS INTO A COMPLETE LABORATORY TESTED RADAR SYSTEM.  THIS SYSTEM WILL ALSO BE CAPABLE OF INTEGRATED OPERATION WITH AUXILIARY NASA AIRBORNE SCIENCE FACILITY SENSORS (A HIGHLY ACCURATE INERTIAL MOTION UNIT (IMU) AND NEAR-INFRARED DIGITAL CAMERA) TO COMPRISE AIRSWOT.  FURTHERMORE, AND IMPORTANTLY, RSS SHALL ADD CALIBRATION LOOPS TO THE RECEIVER ASSEMBLIES TO VERIFY A NEW TECHNIQUE SURFACE WATER OCEAN TOPOGRAPHY (SWOT) PLANS TO EMPLOY FOR CROSS-CHANNEL PHASE CALIBRATION.  UNDER THIS CONTRACT RSS SHALL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TASKS IN SUPPORT OF AIRSWOT PROGRAM AT JET PROPULSION LABORATORY (JPL):  1.	CONTROL AND TIMING UNIT DEVELOPMENT (CTU):  THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CTU ENTAILS DEVELOPING THE CUSTOM FIRMWARE, AND DESIGN AND FABRICATION OF A DIGITAL MEZZANINE CARD THAT WILL BE HOUSED WITHIN THE RADAR INTEGRATED DIGITAL SYSTEM.  2.	DATA RECORDING/STREAMING IMPLEMENTATION.  WITH SEVEN RECEIVE CHANNELS SIMULTANEOUSLY RECORDING THE AIRSWOT RADAR HAS AN AGGREGATE DATA RATE OF UP TO 100 MEGA BYTES/S AND A TOTAL STORAGE REQUIREMENT OF 0.35TERA BYTES/DATA HOUR.  FOR OPERATION IN THE KINGAIR WE WILL UTILIZE A MULTI-TERA BYTES SOLID-STATE DISK ARRAY SOLUTION WITH CUSTOM DRIVERS. 3.	SYSTEM INTEGRATION AND TEST.  A COMPREHENSIVE INTEGRATION AND TEST PROCESS WILL BEGIN WITH SUBSYSTEM-LEVEL TESTING (TO INCLUDE THE CALIBRATION LOOPS), PROGRESSING TO SYSTEM LOOP-BACK TESTING IN THE LABORATORY.  THE ELECTRONICS WILL BE INTEGRATED ONTO A PANEL ASSEMBLY FOR FULL SYSTEM GROUND TESTING IN THE FLIGHT-CONFIGURATION.    4.	MECHANICAL ASSEMBLY AND FABRICATION/AIRWORTHINESS CERTIFICATION.  THIS TASK INCLUDES DESIGN OF THE LOW COEFFICIENTS OF THERMAL EXPANSION (CTE) ANTENNA PANEL.  STRUCTURAL AND AERODYNAMIC ANALYSES SHALL BE PERFORMED ON THE ENTIRE ASSEMBLY TO SATISFY THE NASA AIRWORTHINESS COMPLIANCE REVIEW AND CERTIFICATION. 5.	ANALYSIS AND FINAL REPORT.  DATA COLLECTED DURING TESTING AND/OR FLIGHTS SHALL BE ANALYZED IN TERMS OF SYSTEM PERFORMANCE AND VERIFICATION.  A FINAL REPORT DETAILING THIS PROGRAM SHALL BE COMPILED AND SUBMITTED.

A LACK OF BASELINE INFORMATION HINDERS THE ABILITY OF ASSATEAGUE ISLAND NATIONAL SEASHORE (ASIS) TO PROTECT ITS OCEANIC RESOURCES FROM TWO URGENT THREATS: BENTHIC HABITAT DAMAGE FROM COMMERCIAL FISHING, AND BIOLOGIC AND GEOMORPHIC IMPACTS OF OFFSHORE INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENTS. THE PROJECT WILL PRODUCE BATHYMETRY, SEDIMENT, AND BENTHIC HABITAT MAPS, AND WILL IDENTIFY CRITICAL BENTHIC HABITAT LOCATIONS, SO THAT ASIS CAN EVALUATE THE NEED FOR COMMERCIAL FISHING RESTRICTIONS; FOCUS RESOURCE PROTECTION EFFORTS EFFICIENTLY; MINIMIZE IMPACTS FROM OFFSHORE DEVELOPMENT; UNDERSTAND OR PREDICT CHANGING RESOURCE CONDITIONS; AND PLAN FOR CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF DETAILED MARINE MAPPING METHODOLOGIES AND LONG-TERM MARINE RESOURCE MONITORING PROTOCOLS AT THE PARK AND REGIONAL LEVELS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY MULTIPLE GROUPS.  MARYLAND GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (MGS, AN AGENCY WITHIN THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (MDNR)) WILL BE LEADING THE SEISMIC AND SIDESCAN REMOTE SENSING SURVEY ACTIVITIES, OVERSEEING DATA PROCESSING, AND SHARING THESE DATASETS AND RELATED INSIGHTS WITH THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR.  THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR WILL DEVELOP A BENTHIC SURVEY SAMPLING DESIGN, WILL LEAD ALL BENTHIC SAMPLING SURVEY ACTIVITIES, WILL CLASSIFY BENTHIC HABITATS USING CMECS (NOAA, 2009), WILL DEVELOP AND APPLY A BENTHIC INDEX OF BIOTIC INTEGRITY, WILL CREATE DIGITAL GEOSPATIAL POLYGONS IDENTIFYING BENTHIC HABITATS, WILL PRODUCE HARDCOPY MAPS ILLUSTRATING BENTHIC CLASSIFICATIONS AND LOCATIONS, WILL COMPOSE A FINAL REPORT AS DETAILED IN THIS SCOPE OF WORK, AND WILL CO-HOST A WORKSHOP TO EDUCATE PARK STAFF AND COOPERATORS ABOUT THE PARK S BENTHIC HABITATS AND IMPLICATIONS FOR RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT. MGS WILL PROVIDE SURVEY DATASETS TO THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR WITHIN 5 MONTHS OF SURVEY COMPLETION AND WILL PROVIDE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR TO PARTICIPATE IN THREE DAYS OF THE MAY-JUNE 2011 REMOTE SENSING SURVEYS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE BENTHIC SURVEY DESIGN AND UNDERSTANDING.  MGS AND THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR ARE EXPECTED TO COLLABORATE THROUGHOUT THE PROCESS OF INTERPRETING AND WRITING UP RESULTS, SO THAT THE FINAL CLASSIFICATIONS AND FINAL REPORT PRODUCED BY THE BENTHIC CONTRACTOR WILL INCORPORATE ALL AVAILABLE RELIABLE DATASETS TO DESCRIBE THE NEARSHORE ENVIRONMENT OF ASIS.
